column5: Hi all,  Went out for a late afternoon walleye session after some morning chores. My wife and son went for a nap instead and were going to meet me at the lake later on.  Got into a small trout first cast...and another couple small ones before i got my 'keeper' size ones....straight jigging minnows in 60+ FOW.   Also managed a couple of trout in 22'FOW with surface temps at 70+F while targetting walleye???? Anyway...went and got my wife and son at the dock...headed back out so i could try to catch another walleye...got trout instead.   Jack is really gaining confidence in the boat now and seems to really enjoy it out on the water.   My wife brought me a less than healthy but very well received take away supper....AWESOME GIRL!   Then we packed up the boat and headed to a nearby creek at Jack's request as he loves the waterfall there. We were surprised to still see the suckers running there...but neat to watch....for me anyway....Jack was more interested in throwing sticks in....lol.     LATE AFTERNOON TROUT AND WALLEYE  <iframe width="560" height="315" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/f9pnkjgAYN0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>               LOTS OF SMALL ONES       GOT SOME KEEPER ONES TOO       GOT ONE NICE WALLEYE....ABOUT 27"       PICKED THE WIFE AND JACK UP AT THE LANDING, SUPPER IN THE BOAT,A FEW MORE FISH AND A VISIT TO THE CREEK                           Best way to spend an evening in my book anyway.    Tight lines all!
Awesome Simon !!!! I had Timmies in the middle of Lake of Two Mountains close to Montreal Nice looking Fish. We went for Musky, but settled for Pike.Its all good.
Very nice looks like a great day
Thanks for the report Kids really love moving water
Simon, you're living in paradise. Just awesome!
Lovely video and great report Simon. All I can say is keep them coming  Cheers, Ice Fisherman
Love these reports.....McD's in the boat   Awesome!
